en.page-title: Weverton G. Costa | PhD | Data Scientist | PhD Candidate in Statistics
en.privacy-page-title: Privacy Policy | Weverton Gomes da Costa
en.meta-description: PhD, Data Scientist, and CEO of Conecta GEM. Specialist in applying Statistics, AI, and Machine Learning to solve problems in Genetics and Breeding.
en.projects-meta-description: Explore Weverton Gomes da Costa's Data Science, AI, and Genetics projects, focusing on Machine Learning and Quantitative Genetics.
en.publications-meta-description: Explore Weverton Gomes da Costa's scientific publications, with a focus on Deep Learning, Genetics, and Statistical Analysis.

en.footer-bio: PhD, Data Scientist, and PhD Candidate in Statistics focused on applying AI and ML to solve challenges in Genetics.
en.subtitle-1: Data Scientist | PhD Candidate in Statistics
en.about-p1: Administrador, atualmente em transi√ß√£o de carreira para Ci√™ncia de Dados e Intelig√™ncia Artificial.
en.about-p2: This passion for disseminating knowledge culminated in the co-founding of Conecta GEM, where I serve as CEO. Conecta GEM is an initiative focused on offering cutting-edge training, consulting, and mentorship to the scientific community. Leading this mission, we have already qualified over a thousand people in technical courses on statistics and genetics, in addition to performing various specialized analyses.
en.about-p3: My technical expertise ranges from quantitative genetics and genomic selection to developing analysis pipelines (R and Python) and applying advanced models (Machine Learning and Neural Networks). I actively collaborate on cutting-edge research at the Bioinformatics Laboratory at UFV and the Computational Intelligence and Statistical Learning Laboratory (LICAE), where I also contribute to coordinating and mentoring research teams, joining efforts to advance the frontiers of biometrics and AI applied to agriculture.
en.service-desc1: I offer specialized consulting for research institutions and breeding companies, transforming raw data into strategic insights and actionable predictive models.
en.service-desc2: I am always open to new collaborations on research projects involving genetics, breeding, biometrics, and the application of artificial intelligence in agriculture.
en.service-desc3: I conduct custom courses and training on GENES software, R, Python, genomic selection, and machine learning for teams and researchers.
en.edu-title1: PhD in Applied Statistics and Biometrics
en.edu-desc1: Conducting research to develop and apply novel statistical and machine learning models for complex problems in biometrics.
en.edu-desc2: Development and application of machine learning (ML) models to optimize genomic selection accuracy. Application of deep learning (Mask R-CNN) for phenotypic characterization (weight prediction) in cattle and swine.
en.edu-desc3: Research focused on genomic selection and machine learning, collaborating with various genetic improvement projects.
en.edu-desc4: Data analysis (GWS/GWAS) in the NextGen Cassava project, aiming to develop resilient cassava cultivars.
en.edu-desc5: Application and comparison of multiple machine learning models and neural networks (vs. GBLUP) aimed at increasing the accuracy of genomic selection and identifying important genetic markers.
en.edu-advisor5:
Advisor: Prof. Cosme Dami√£o Cruz.
Co-advisor: Prof. Moyses Nascimento.
en.edu-desc6: Dissertation focused on applying Meta-Analysis and multivariate statistics to evaluate genetic parameters in irrigated rice genotypes.
en.edu-advisor6:
Advisor: Prof. Alu√≠zio Bor√©m de Oliveira.
Co-advisor: Prof. Cosme Dami√£o Cruz.
en.edu-desc7: Final project focused on experimental design and undergraduate research in genetic data analysis and plant breeding.
en.exp-desc1: Analysis and modeling of complex traits, estimation of genetic parameters, and prediction of genetic values to optimize breeding programs.
en.exp-desc2: Application of mixed models, Genomic Wide Selection (GWS), and GWAS (Genome-Wide Association Study) for marker identification and the study of complex traits in quantitative genetics.
en.exp-desc3: Use of algorithms, neural networks, and AI for genomic prediction, genotype classification, and pattern identification in biological data.
en.exp-desc4: Development of automated data analysis pipelines in R and Python, with code versioning and project management on GitHub to ensure reproducibility and scientific collaboration.
en.exp-desc5: Planning and execution of breeding programs, from conducting experiments to selecting superior genotypes based on phenotypic and genomic data.
en.exp-desc7: Proficiency in statistical software such as GENES, Selegen, R, and Python for genetic and statistical data analysis with biometric models, covering everything from experimental statistics and biometrics to multivariate analyses for estimating genetic parameters.
en.licae-desc: LICAE is a multidisciplinary laboratory dedicated to proposing, evaluating, and applying Computational Intelligence and Statistical Learning techniques to solve complex problems in agriculture. Our goal is to enhance and complement traditional biometric methodologies by developing innovative projects in areas such as Neural Networks, Genomic Selection, and Random Forest.
en.licae-item1: Research in neural networks and genomic selection
en.conecta-desc: Conecta GEM was born from a passion for sharing knowledge. We are an initiative that offers excellence in training, consulting, and mentorship in statistics, genetics, and breeding. With expert coordinators and a methodology focused on individual learning, we have already qualified over a thousand people, connecting university theory with market practice.
en.conecta-item3: Training and workshops in R and Python

en.privacy-intro-p: This Privacy Policy describes how personal information is collected, used, and shared when you visit this website and use the contact form.
en.privacy-collection-p1: The only personal information we collect is what you voluntarily provide to us through the contact form. This includes:
en.privacy-collection-p2: We do not use cookies for tracking or collecting browsing data.
en.privacy-usage-p: The information provided in the contact form is used exclusively for the purpose of responding to your request or message. Your data will not be stored on this site, used for marketing purposes, or shared with third parties, except for the form processing service.
en.privacy-services-p: This site uses the following third-party services:
en.privacy-services-li1: To process and forward messages sent via the contact form to my email. Formspree has its own privacy policy, which you can consult on their website.
en.privacy-security-p: Although no method of transmission over the Internet or electronic storage is 100% secure, we take reasonable precautions to protect your information. Traffic on this site is protected by HTTPS.
en.privacy-rights-p: You have the right to request information about the data you have provided and to ask for its deletion at any time by contacting me directly at

en.lattes_summary: Agronomist (2015), MSc in Genetics and Breeding (2018), and PhD in Genetics and Breeding (2022) from the Federal University of Vi√ßosa (UFV). Currently, he is a PhD candidate in the Statistics Department at UFV and a postdoctoral researcher (FAPEMIG/CNPq). He has consolidated experience in data analysis applied to genetics, having worked as a postdoctoral researcher at Embrapa Cassava and Fruit... He is also the co-founder and coordinator of Conecta GEM... training over a thousand participants... He has experience in plant breeding, quantitative genetics... with proficiency in software such as R, Python, GENES, and Selegen.
en.cv_pro_summary: Data Scientist and Ph.D. in Genetics, currently pursuing a Doctorate in Statistics. I have practical experience applying statistical and machine learning models to solve complex problems in agricultural and biological sciences. As Co-founder and CEO of Conecta GEM, I directly conduct client-facing data analysis, transforming raw data into reports and insights that support decision-making. My research focuses on optimizing the accuracy of predictive models, from genomic selection to phenotypic characterization with deep learning (Mask R-CNN).
en.cv_acad_summary: Researcher with a Ph.D. in Genetics and Breeding, and a doctoral candidate in Applied Statistics and Biometrics. My career is focused on the intersection of quantitative genetics, bioinformatics, and machine learning to advance breeding research. Currently a Postdoctoral Researcher at UFV, I develop and apply ML/DL models to increase the accuracy of genomic selection and for precision phenotyping. My previous experience at EMBRAPA involved optimizing data analysis pipelines (NextGen) and selection models.

bullets: Managed data analysis projects and consultancies (Statistics, Genetics, and ML) for clients and research groups.
Coordinated and developed technical courses (R, Python, Statistics), training over 1,000 people across 15+ countries.
Responsible for client data analysis, from processing to delivering reports and actionable insights.
Applied ML/DL (including Mask R-CNN) to optimize genomic selection and for precision phenotyping (weight prediction) in swine and cattle (UFV).
Developed and automated genomic analysis pipelines (GWAS, GWS) for the cassava breeding program (Embrapa).
Optimized routines (R, Python) for large-scale genotyping data processing and NextGen data analysis (Embrapa).

portfolio_project_website.title: Personal Web Portfolio (CV Automation)
portfolio_project_website.description: I developed this site from scratch as a central hub for my roles (CEO, Researcher, Data Scientist). I set up R and Python routines that consume GitHub and Google Scholar APIs, automatically updating my project and publication lists. I implemented multilingual support (JavaScript i18n) and a 100% responsive design (HTML/CSS/JS) with a functional contact form.
